title: How to Prepare a House for a Stuffed Animal's Arrival

steps.headline: Find a fairly large cardboard box.
steps.description: This will be your house. You can downsize it if you want if your stuffed animal is small, but if it is larger, you'll need a larger box!

steps.headline: Paint or color the box's outside.
steps.description: Mahogany and white for bricks, whatever color for siding, dark brown for wood, whatever materials for a house and the comprehending color(s).

steps.headline: Paint or color the area where you will put the door.
steps.description: You can do a glass door in blue and white, brown, black, gray, etc. Wood doors are the same, but don't use blue. Folding doors? Whatever color you want! Make sure the other side is the same color as the front!

steps.headline: Paint or color the inside.
steps.description: When you are doing this, think "What will my stuffed animal be?" as this helps you think of what colors and themes to use. Is your pet a girl or a boy? What's their favorite color? What is your pet's pet breed? These are good questions to ask yourself when you are designing the inside.

steps.headline: Cut the door so that it opens and closes.
steps.description: Cut windows. These will let in light for your seemingly dark and forbidding house.

steps.headline: Paint or color the area around where you will put windows.
Make some furniture!
steps.description: If you want wood furniture, ask a friend who is good with wood, unless you are good with wood yourself. Clay furniture will take up a lot of time, but it's worth it.

steps.headline: Sew a mattress for the bed, cushions for the chairs and couch, etc.
steps.description: Your pet will thank you for this, as wood and clay are uncomfortable to sit on and sleep on.

steps.headline: Sew some sheets for your bed!
steps.description: This is also a good time to think of your pet's personality. Is your new stuffed animal playful? Shy? Caring?

steps.headline: Set up some areas in YOUR house for your new stuffed animal to play, meet friends, hang out, go to a pool, etc.
steps.description: These spots will be your hot spots. You'll be glad you did this later.

steps.headline: When you have your stuffed animal, make some clothes for it!
steps.description: Stuffed animals don't like walking around with no clothes on! Think of pajamas, everyday clothes, fancy clothes, a bathing suit, etc.

steps.headline: Have fun!
steps.description: Having fun with your new stuffed animal is the most important thing after you get your animal.
